item.description:
Winter in the Whites...and time for ice climbing.

Let's meet up for for a day of top rope ice climbing at Kinsman Notch. The plan is to climb WI3's. We'll meet at Annie's Dinner at 7 AM, have a small breakfast, then carpool to the trail head.  Or, if you prefer, meet us at 8 AM at the Kinsman Notch trail head.  Kinsman gets busy, so we need to start hiking at 8 AM, preferably before.

The trail head is on Route 112 NH, about a mile west past 118, 5 miles west of Woodstock.  The ice climb is a 15 minute hike up the mountain on the south side of 112.

You must have mountaineering boots, crampons, harness, locking biner+belay device, helmet, balaclava, two or more pairs of gloves (they get wet), water proof (eg, Gore-Tex) tops and bottoms, warm fleece layers, and thermal wicking layer. If you have ice tools, ropes, biners, screws, anchor material, bring those too.

For more information, check out the FAQ's on ice climbing.

For weather, Accuweather, Mount Washington Observatory

Current ice climbing conditions: neice.com, neclimbs.com
item.name: Ice climbing at Kinsman Notch
